context: A security incident flagged a possible attempt to access a Primary Refresh Token (PRT) on a system, executed by the process `browsercore.exe` with Process ID 2676 on 2024-06-20t09:10:59.867384z. PRT is crucial for Azure AD authentication and attackers might be targeting it for lateral movement or credential theft.
question: Can you identify what process was used to disable the system recovery feature on the same indar kasoo
solution_steps: There is a possible attempt to access Primary Refresh Token (PRT) associated with the AadUserId `731adb71-b11c-4bbf-850b-57989b350e96`.
System recovery setting tampering was detected with process ID `8136`, created at `2024-06-20t09:10:48.0438707z` with command line `bcdedit /set recoveryenabled no`.
